venue.name: Cambridge Center for Adult Education, Blacksmith House

item.description:
This event is one in a continuing series of events organized by the Cambridge Center For Adult Education and takes place on Wednesday, May 12 at 8 pm.

How did Boston become the most sports crazed city in America? Christopher Klien, author of "The Die-hard Sports Fan's Guide to Boston," will talk about the evolution of Boston's legendary sports history and some of its great sporting characters. Take a virtual tour of some of the city's past and present sporting venues, and try your hand at trivia questions that will test the knowledge of even the most die-hard fan. This event will have something for rookies and old-timers.

Cost is $10.00 Event code is BSPO

Please visit for more information and to register. Or call 617-547-6789.

Event will take place in Harvard Square with Red Line access. $5.00 parking stickers for the Charles Hotel Garage are available at each event.

Additional events are posted on the Red Sox Natives calendar.
item.name: "The History of Sports in Boston" -
